title: Cat. 24  Salver, 1755/53
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Myer Myers (American, 1723–1795)  
New York, New York  
Silver; 3.8 × 40.6 cm (1 1/2 × 16 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, restricted gift of Warren L. Batts, Quinn E. Delaney, Jamee J. and Marshall Field, Mrs. Harold T. Martin, Brooks McCormick, Mrs. Eric Oldberg, Mrs. Frank L. Sulzberger, the Maurice Freemen Fund in honor of Mrs. Eric Oldberg, the Mrs. Jacob H. Bischof Fund, Wesley M. Dixon, Jr., Laura S. Matthews and John Puth funds, and Major Acquisitions Centennial Endowment, 1987.174

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">On the bottom six times (fig. 24.1)

Engraved on reverse though partially erased: P / TM and oz dwt / 50 : 9

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">With Firestone and Parson, Boston, by 1987.

Sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1987.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Art Institute of Chicago (1988a), p. 15, pl. 26.

</section><section id="figures">Salver, 1755/53.

fig. 24.1 </section>
